SEARCH
Module com.example.umlscd
Package com.example.umlscd.Models.ClassDiagram

Class UMLRelationshipBox

java.lang.Object
com.example.umlscd.Models.ClassDiagram.UMLRelationshipBox
public class UMLRelationshipBox extends Object

UML Relationship Box

The UMLRelationshipBox class represents a visual UML Relationship within the UML Editor application. It encapsulates the graphical components and metadata associated with a UML relationship between two UML elements, such as classes or interfaces. This class is designed to facilitate the rendering and management of relationships like Association, Aggregation, Composition, and Inheritance in the user interface.

Key functionalities include:

  • Storing relationship metadata, including type, connected elements, name, and multiplicities.
  • Managing the visual representation of the relationship through JavaFX Line and Text nodes.
  • Providing methods to access and modify both the metadata and visual components.
  • Converting the visual relationship into a serializable UMLRelationship model object.

Authors: Ahmad Wyne, Wahaj Asif, Muhammad Muneeb

Version: 1.0

Since: 2024-12-03

  • Constructor Details

    • UMLRelationshipBox

      public UMLRelationshipBox()
      Default constructor for Jackson deserialization.

      This constructor is necessary for the Jackson library to deserialize JSON data into a UMLRelationshipBox instance.

    • UMLRelationshipBox

      public UMLRelationshipBox(String type, String startElementName, String endElementName, String name, String startMultiplicity, String endMultiplicity, javafx.scene.shape.Line line, javafx.scene.text.Text label, javafx.scene.text.Text startMultiplicityText, javafx.scene.text.Text endMultiplicityText)
      Constructs a UMLRelationshipBox with specified parameters.

      This constructor initializes the relationship with its type, connected elements, name, multiplicities, and its visual representation in the UI.

      Parameters:
      type - The type of relationship (e.g., Association).
      startElementName - The name of the starting element.
      endElementName - The name of the ending element.
      name - The name of the relationship.
      startMultiplicity - The multiplicity at the start.
      endMultiplicity - The multiplicity at the end.
      line - The Line node representing the relationship in the UI.
      label - The Text node for the relationship name.
      startMultiplicityText - The Text node for the start multiplicity.
      endMultiplicityText - The Text node for the end multiplicity.

      public String getType()
      Retrieves the type of the UML relationship.
      Returns:
      A String representing the type of the relationship.

    • setType

      public void setType(String type)
      Sets the type of the UML relationship.

      Valid types include "Association", "Aggregation", "Composition", and "Inheritance".

      Parameters:
      type - A String specifying the type of the relationship.

      Returns:
      A String representing the start multiplicity.

    • setStartMultiplicity

      public void setStartMultiplicity(String startMultiplicity)
      Sets the multiplicity at the start end of the UML relationship.

      Multiplicity defines how many instances of the start element can be associated with the end element. Examples include "1", "0..*", "1..*", etc.

      Parameters:
      startMultiplicity - A String specifying the start multiplicity.

    • getEndMultiplicity

      public String getEndMultiplicity()
      Retrieves the multiplicity at the end end of the UML relationship.
      Returns:
      A String representing the end multiplicity.

    • setEndMultiplicity

      public void setEndMultiplicity(String endMultiplicity)
      Sets the multiplicity at the end end of the UML relationship.

      Multiplicity defines how many instances of the end element can be associated with the start element. Examples include "1", "0..*", "1..*", etc.

      Parameters:
      endMultiplicity - A String specifying the end multiplicity.

      The Line node, or null if not set.

      Parameters:

    • getUmlRelationship

      public UMLRelationship getUmlRelationship()
      Converts this UMLRelationshipBox to a UMLRelationship model object.

      This method creates a new UMLRelationship instance based on the current state of this UMLRelationshipBox, excluding the transient UI components. This is useful for serialization purposes where only the essential relationship data needs to be persisted.

      Returns:
      A UMLRelationship object representing this relationship.

    • setAssociationName

      public void setAssociationName(String newName)
      Sets the Association Name for the relation
      Parameters:
      newName - A String specifying the new name for the relationship
